channel.title: Latest News | IB2: Integrative Bioinformatics and Biostatistics

item.title: New slide scanner
item.description: Starting this month, we have a new scanner to support our histopathology image analysis projects. This is a 3D Histech scanner for small-to-medium throughput but producing high quality images both in brightfield and fluorescence modalities.

item.title: QBI SABI 2023
item.description:
The Spatial Analysis for Biological Imaging workshop.

We present new results from the analysis of the spatial distribution of T-cells in colorectal cancer. These results were obtained in the framework of the AZV-funded project.

item.title: CZEDER 2023
item.description:
The 20th Czech Days for European Research, Prague, CZ.

The Oncobiome project was presented at the 20th CZEDER, organized by the Technology Centre Prague. At the meeting, Drs. Budinská and Popovici presented the project and some of its most salient results, as well as other activities of RECETOX.

item.title: Oncobiome General Assembly meeting
item.description:
The 2022 Oncobiome’s GA meeting took place in Torino, IT.

The Oncobiome project had its 2022’s General Assembly meeting hosted by our colleagues in Torino, Dr Alessio Naccarati (IIGM) and Dr Francesca Cordero (University of Turin). At the meeting, Drs. Budinská and Popovici presented our group’s recent results on building predictors based on miRNA and metagenomics data.

item.title: Cytomine server is working!
item.description:
The local Cytomine server is up and running!

Finally! We have our own server for hosting the whole slide images: visit CPath to have a look.

Our ever-growing collection of pathology images has a new home. The Cytomine server has been deployed locally and it already hosts more than 1,000 slides. It enables us a faster and more convenint collaboration with colleagues from Pathology departments.
